Citation.Originator: U.S. Department of Commerce, U.S. Census Bureau, Geography Division
Citation.Title: Census Physical Features WMS

Description.Abstract:
TIGERweb files are designed for Viewing TIGER\Line spatial data online or streaming to your mapping application.The TIGER/Line shapefiles and related database files (.dbf) are an extract of selected geographic and cartographic information from the U.S. Census Bureau's Master Address File / Topologically Integrated Geographic Encoding and Referencing (MAF/TIGER) Database (MTDB).
The Census Physical Features WMS contians the following layers: Military Installations, Colleges and Universities, Correctional Facilities, National Park Service Areas, Glaciers, Areal Hydrography, Linear Hydrography, Railroads, Local Roads, Secondary Roads, and Primary Roads.
Description.Purpose: To provide a simple HTTP interface for requesting geo-registered map images from our geospatial database. The response to the request is one or more geo-registered map images that can be displayed in a browser or WMS client application. By gaining access to our data through our WMS, users can produce maps containing TIGERweb layers combined with layers from other servers.

Place.Place_Keyword_Thesaurus: National Standard Codes (ANSI INCITS 38-2009), Federal Information Processing Series (FIPS) – States/State Equivalents
ISO 3166: Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions

Constraints.Other_Constraints: Use Constraints: These products are free to use in a product or publication, however acknowledgement must be given to the U.S. Census Bureau as the source. WMS boundary files should not be used for geographic analysis including area or perimeter calculation. Files should not be used for geocoding addresses. Files should not be used for determining precise geographic area relationships.

Point_of_Contact.Contact_Organization: U.S. Department of Commerce, U.S. Census Bureau, Geography Division

Test_Report.Measure: TIGER/Line Shapefile Quantitative Attribute Accuracy Test
Test_Report.Evaluation: Manual and automatic examination of the Non_Quantitative attribute information
Test_Report.Result: This information is not fully accurate

Test_Report.Measure: National Standard Codes, Federal Information Processing (FIPS) and the Geographic Names Information System (GNIS) TIGER/Line Shapefile Test
Test_Report.Evaluation: Tested against National Standard Codes, Federal Information Processing (FIPS) and the Geographic Names Information System (GNIS)
Test_Report.Result: 100% accurate for the codes and base names.

Test_Report.Measure: The Census Bureau performed automated tests to ensure logical consistency and limits of shapefiles.
Test_Report.Evaluation: Node/geometry and topology relationships are collected or generated to satisfy topological edit requirements. These requirements include: (1) Complete chains must begin and end at nodes. (2) Complete chains must connect to each other at nodes. (3) Complete chains do not extend through nodes. (4) Left and right polygons are defined for each complete chain element and are consistent throughout the extract process. (5) The chains representing the limits of the files are free of gaps.
Test_Report.Result: There may be some inconsistencies in feature names along features. An anomaly exists with the sporadic occurrence of road segments comprising a complete chain with different MAF/TIGER Feature Census Class Code (MTFCC) values assigned. This problem could affect applications that use the MTFCC values for network analysis, routing, or for assigning symbology to a feature when creating a map.

Test_Report.Measure: Data completeness of the TIGER/Line Shapefiles
Test_Report.Result: Data completeness of the TIGER/Line Shapefiles reflects the contents of the Census MAF/TIGER database at the time the TIGER/Line Shapefiles were created.

Test_Report.Measure: The Census Bureau uses root mean square error (RMSE) as stated in the FGDC-STD-007. 3-1998, Geospatial Positioning Accuracy Standards, Part 3: National Standard for Spatial Data Accuracy.
Test_Report.Evaluation: The Census Bureau uses Global Positioning System (GPS) coordinates at road centerline intersections to evaluate the horizontal spatial accuracy of source files that may be used to realign road features in the MAF/TIGER database and test the horizontal spatial accuracy of the road features in the TIGER/Line Shapefiles. The test compares a survey-grade GPS coordinate to its associated road centerline intersection in the TIGER/Line Shapefiles. The test is based on an independent collection of GPS coordinates for a random sample of road intersections from a centerline file that meet certain criteria. The points are referred to as the sample points and are gathered through a private contractor working for the Census Bureau. Since the collection method uses survey-quality GPS-based field techniques, the resulting control points are considered 'ground truth' against which the TIGER road centerline intersection coordinates are compared. The distances between the coordinates are calculated and the Census Bureau determines the Circular Error 95% (CE95). That is, the accuracy of the file in meters with 95% confidence. The CE95 can be calculated from the mean and standard deviation by using the formula: mean of differences plus (2.65 times the standard deviation). CE95 results reported for each file tested are determined using a spreadsheet with embedded statistical formula. The use and applicability of the spreadsheet and its embedded formula have been verified by Census Bureau statisticians. The basis of the calculation is the use of the root mean square error (RMSE). This is the method as stated in the U.S. Government's Federal Geographic Data Committee Standard FGDC-STD-007.3-1998, Geospatial Positioning Accuracy Standards. Part 3: National Standard for Spatial Data Accuracy. The results of using this measure of accuracy are in compliance with Federal Spatial Data requirements. In terms of the Census Bureau application, the dataset coordinate values are those taken from the centerline file and the coordinate values from an independent source of higher accuracy are those acquired through the Census Bureau's contractor. Please note that the horizontal spatial accuracy, where reported, refers only to the realigned road features identified as matched to the positionally accurate source file with that accuracy. It is not the spatial accuracy of the TIGER/Line Shapefile as a whole.

Citation.Originator: U.S. Department of Commerce, U.S. Census Bureau, Geography Division
Citation.Title: Census MAF/TIGER database

Process_Step.Process_Description: TIGERWeb files are extracted from the Census MAF/TIGER database twice a year.

Spatial_Data_Organization_Information.Indirect_Spatial_Reference: Federal Information Processing Series (FIPS), Geographic Names Information System (GNIS), and feature names.

Point_of_Contact.Contact_Organization: Geography Division, Spatial Products Software Branch

Distribution_Information.Distribution_Liability: This WMS contains geographic data only and do not include display mapping software or statistical data. For information on how to use the TIGER/Line shapefile data with specific software package users shall contact the company that produced the software. To use this WMS in a web browser, reference the OGC specification.

Standard_Order_Process.Fees: Census Web Mapping Services may be accessed without charge.

Contains_Operations.Operation_Description:
The Open Geospatial Consortium, Inc. Off Site (OGC) Web Map Service interface standard (WMS) provides a simple HTTP interface for requesting geo-registered map images from our geospatial database. The response to the request is one or more geo-registered map images that can be displayed in a browser or WMS client application. By gaining access to our data through our WMS, users can produce maps containing TIGERweb layers combined with layers from other servers.
The GetCapabilities operation returns parameters about the WMS. It returns results in the following formats: application/vnd.ogc.wms_xml text/xml

Operation_Parameters.Parameter_Description: Request version
Service type
request name

Contains_Operations.Operation_Description:
The Open Geospatial Consortium, Inc. Off Site (OGC) Web Map Service interface standard (WMS) provides a simple HTTP interface for requesting geo-registered map images from our geospatial database. The response to the request is one or more geo-registered map images that can be displayed in a browser or WMS client application. By gaining access to our data through our WMS, users can produce maps containing TIGERweb layers combined with layers from other servers.
The GetMap operation returns a map image. It returns results in the following formats: image/bmp image/jpeg image/tiff image/png image/png8 image/png24 image/png32 image/gif image/svg+xml

Operation_Parameters.Parameter_Description: request version.
request name
Comma-separated list of one or more map layers.
Comma-separated list of one rendering style per requested layer.
Coordinate reference system.
Bounding box corners (lower left, upper right) in CRS units.
Width in pixels of map picture.
Height in pixels of map picture.
Output format of map.
Background transparency of map (default=FALSE).
Hexadecimal red-green-blue color value for the background color (default=0xFFFFFF)
The format in which exceptions are to be reported by the WMS (default=XML).
Time value of layer desired.
Elevation of layer desired.
Value of other dimensions as appropriate.

Contains_Operations.Operation_Description:
The Open Geospatial Consortium, Inc. Off Site (OGC) Web Map Service interface standard (WMS) provides a simple HTTP interface for requesting geo-registered map images from our geospatial database. The response to the request is one or more geo-registered map images that can be displayed in a browser or WMS client application. By gaining access to our data through our WMS, users can produce maps containing TIGERweb layers combined with layers from other servers.
The GetFeatureInfo operation provides clients of a WMS with more information about features in the pictures of maps that were returned by previous Map requests. It is only supported for those Layers for which the attribute queryable="1" (true) has been defined or inherited. It is availiable in the following formats: application/vnd.esri.wms_raw_xml application/vnd.esri.wms_featureinfo_xml application/vnd.ogc.wms_xml application/geojson text/xml text/html text/plain

Operation_Parameters.Parameter_Description: request version.
request name
Partial copy of the Map request parameters that generated the map for which information is desired.
Comma-separated list of one or more layers to be queried.
Return format of feature information (MIME type).
Number of features about which to return information (default=1).
i coordinate in pixels of feature in Map CS.
j coordinate in pixels of feature in Map CS.
The format in which exceptions are to be reported by the WMS (default= XML).

Contains_Operations.Operation_Description: The Open Geospatial Consortium, Inc. Off Site (OGC) Web Map Service interface standard (WMS) provides a simple HTTP interface for requesting geo-registered map images from our geospatial database. The response to the request is one or more geo-registered map images that can be displayed in a browser or WMS client application. By gaining access to our data through our WMS, users can produce maps containing TIGERweb layers combined with layers from other servers. The esri_wms:GetStyles operation returns user-defined styles from the WMS.It supports the following formats: application/vnd.ogc.sld+xml

Operation_Parameters.Parameter_Description: Version as required by OGC interfaces.
Request name. It must be set to GetStyles.
Comma-separated list of named layers for which to retrieve style descriptions.
The SLD version requested for the Styled Layer Descriptor (SLD) document. Only version 1.0.0 is supported.
